section.name: Overview
section.p: This document explains the Apache FTP Server configuration parameters. All the configuration parameters are grouped depending on the component where it has been used. This configuration format is very much open to suite the user requirements. The server comes with two different configuration implementations - properties file based and XML file based configurations (./res/ftpd.properties and ./res/ftpd.xml). You can have your own Configuration implementation. You just need to implement org.apache.ftpserver.ftplet.Configuration interface. Most of the configuration parameters have default values. So you do not have to specify all the configuration parameters.
The configuration parameters follow a tree hierarchy.
Only the leaf nodes can have configuration values. That is in the above hierarchy only n3 and n4 can have values. If we assume that the value of n3 is v3 and the value of n4 is v4.

tr.td:
The socket factory class
org.apache.ftpserver.socketfactory.FtpSocketFactory : Plain socket - supports explicit SSL connection (AUTH SSL)
org.apache.ftpserver.socketfactory.SSLFtpSocketFactory : implicit SSL socket
Keystore file location. The default path is ./res/.keystore
Keystore password. The default value is password.
Keystore type. The default value is JKS.
Keystore protocol. The default value is TLS.
Keystore algorithm. The default value is SunX509.
Client authentication. The default value is false.
Key password. The default value is password.
FTP passive (PASV) address The default is localhost.
Allowed passive ports (comma separated). 0 means any free port. The default is 0.
PORT data connection enabled. The default is true.
Check the PORT IP with the client IP. The default is false.
Keystore file location. The default is ./res/.keystore
Keystore password. The default is password.
Keystore type. The default value is JKS.
Keystore protocol. The default value is TLS.
Keystore algorithm. The default value is SunX509.
Need client authentication? The default is false.
Key password. The default is password.
Flag to indicate whether the standard users (admin and anonymous) will be created by default if not found. The admin user password will be same as admin user name. The default is true.
The directory where user defined custom FTP server replies will be stored. The default value is ./res
Comma separated values of all the languages supported. The default value is null.
Maximum simultaneous connections (0 means no limit). The default value is 20.
Maximum simultaneous logins (0 means no limit). The default value is 10.
Flag to indicate annonymous login support. By default the server allows anonymous connections. That is the default value is true.

Maximum anonymous simultaneous logins (0 means no limit). Should be less than or equal to the maximum number of simultaneous logins. It will not be used if the sever does not allow anonymous login. The default value is 10.
Default idle time in seconds. It is used to close idle data connection and non-logged-in connections. The default value is 60.
Polling interval in seconds to disconnect idle users. The default value is 60.

Logger implementation class.
File based logger (default) - org.apache.ftpserver.logger.FileLogger
Console based logger - org.apache.ftpserver.logger.ConsoleLogger

Log level. The default value is 1.
0 : Debug
1 : Information
2 : Warning
3 : Error
Log entry timestamp format. The default is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss
The directory where log files will be stored. The default is ./res/log
Log file maximum size (0 means no limit) in kbytes. The default is 0.
Flag to indicate to flush log every time after writing. The default is true.
The file where IP restriction information will be stored. The default is ./res/ip.gen

The user manager implementation class.
org.apache.ftpserver.usermanager.PropertiesUserManager - Properties file based defaul user manager class.
org.apache.ftpserver.usermanager.DbUserManager - Database based user manager class.
org.apache.ftpserver.usermanager.LdapUserManager - Ldap based user manager class.
FTP server administrator name. It is used in properties, database and LDAP based user managers. The default value is admin.
The properies file location - used in properties file based user manager. The default value is ./res/user.gen
Flag to indicate whether the encrypted password will be stored in the properties file. It is used in properties file based user manager. The default value is true.
JDBC driver class name - used in database based user manager.
JDBC URL used in database based user manager.
Database user used in database based user manager. The default value is null.
Database password - used in database based user manager. The default is null.

SQL INSERT statement used to add a new user. All the dynamic values will be replaced during runtime. Sample query:
INSERT INTO FTP_USER (uid, userpassword, homedirectory, enableflag, writepermission, idletime, uploadrate, downloadrate) VALUES ('{uid}', '{userpassword}', '{homedirectory}', '{enableflag}', '{writepermission}', {idletime}, {uploadrate}, {downloadrate})

SQL UPDATE statement used to update an existing user. All the dynamic values will be replaced during runtime. Sample query:
UPDATE FTP_USER SET userpassword='{userpassword}',homedirectory='{homedirectory}', enableflag='{enableflag}',writepermission='{writepermission}', idletime={idletime},uploadrate={uploadrate}, downloadrate={downloadrate} WHERE uid='{uid}'
SQL DELETE statement used to delete an existing user. All the dynamic values will be replaced during runtime. Sample query: DELETE FROM FTP_USER WHERE uid = '{uid}'

SQL SELECT statement used to select an existing user. All the dynamic values will be replaced during runtime. Sample query:
SELECT uid, userpassword, homedirectory, enableflag, writepermission, idletime, uploadrate, downloadrate FROM FTP_USER WHERE uid = '{uid}'
SQL SELECT statement used to select all user ids. All the dynamic values will be replaced during runtime. Sample query: SELECT uid FROM FTP_USER ORDER BY uid

SQL SELECT statement used to authenticate user. All the dynamic values will be replaced during runtime. Sample query:
SELECT uid FROM FTP_USER WHERE uid='{uid}' AND userpassword='{userpassword}'
LDAP server authentication type. The default value is simple.
LDAP server root where all users are stored (eg. ou=people,o=yoursite.com).
Flag to indicate whether user home directory will be created if not exists.
For each ftplet there must be one configuration parameter. This is ftplet implementation class.
Each ftplet can have its own configuration parameters.
